name: Wingate by Wyndham Streetsboro

reviews.text: The staff was very nice, the hotel was convenient right off the Ohio Turnpike. Had the pool to ourselves, the rooms were very nice and spacious with a full couch and a fridge and micro right in room. Not overpriced, and definitely worth what we paid. Nice, free breakfast. Would definitely come back! A Ruby Tuesdays right next door that you can walk to. Can get a room with a jacuzzi tub at no extra cost!
reviews.title: Everything Was Great! Highly Recommend this hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week while attending a convention in Cleveland. It's quite a drive from the city, so I wouldn't recommend it to somebody who will be going back and forth into the city. The staff was pleasant. Check-in and check-out was fast. The breakfast was good. Overall a nice hotel. My shower, though, had a moldy curtain which made that portion of the room smell. But the room was huge. I'd stay there again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Overall, pretty nice

reviews.text: A very good hotel for a good price. The complementary hot breakfast was excellent and made this hotel a real deal.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Stayed at Wingate for the first time one night while on a long drive. Just drove by and got a room for around $95. The room was disappointing with it's moldy tub, stained carpet, and those dated bedcovers that most hotels have phased out-the kind that strip from the bed before getting in for fear of waking up with it touching you! The pool/hot tub/sauna were nice to have but needed some cleaning. The lobby is very nice, breakfast is good, they just need to work on updating those rooms to match.
reviews.title: Not going back to Wingate.

reviews.text: The Wingate staff accommodated every need. Even though they had a nearly full (if not completely booked) roster, we felt like we were the only guest to which they had to attend. We noticed other guests were receiving the same "red carpet" treatment too.
reviews.title: Wintastic

reviews.text: The room was very clean and had plenty of room. We came in late evening and there weren't many rooms available but they were able to accomadate us by finding a room with a king bed and a fold out couch for my 4 year. The pool was open and clean. Breakfast was wonderful as well. I would definitley recommend this and I plan on staying here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped overnight coming and going to an event. There are a number of restaurants within a block of the parking lot and a nice one right next door. The pool could have been a little warmer but we were given good service.
reviews.title: Good for overnight stop

reviews.text: Unfortunately, I picked the wrong weekend to try and get a room - all rooms at the Hampton were booked, so I took one of the last two suites available at the Wingate. I was expecting a high quality, after all, this was a wingate! OMG, so gross! Physical dirt and some sort of bodily fluid (Okay - a lugy) in the elevator. The laundry room was so dirty. Our suite was okay, I was surprised. No updates, but clean. Breakfast was GONE when we got downstairs at 0730 in the morning. You would think with a completely booked hotel (last suite was taken while we were signing in), they would have made arrangements to have everything stocked.
reviews.title: Really Filthy Hotel- Do not stay-Keep driving

reviews.text: I wrote a review and gave it to the day manager, but I bet that went into a circular file.
reviews.title: Excellent stay, great room, outstanding breakfast
Excellent Hotel and Value
reviews.text: I would have left, but my 8 year old was so tired after driving all day and all of the rooms within 40 miles were booked (sports weekend).

While we usually stay at Hamptons, this hotel we were able to get for low $80 and was every bit as nice as most Hamptons. Other area hotels rated above this were atleast $20 more a night for same thing (lower end chains).
reviews.title: Best value in area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Clean room, refrig and microwave, kids enjoyed larger indoor pool, large breakfast area, neutrogena bath products
reviews.title: A solid Streetsboro hotel

reviews.text: Cons: Thin floors (could hear people above us although air conditioning masked most of it). Breakfast was only served until 9:30...would have liked it to stay open until 10.
reviews.title: Wow, What a nasty place for $85.00 A night!Please save your $$!

reviews.text: OK, let's be real - this ain't the Four Seasons, folks. It's a hotel on an exit of the Turnpike.
reviews.title: DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS HOTEL THEY ARE CRIMMINALS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And having said that - we've stayed here three or four times now, and it's a very solid, clean, dependable choice. Clean rooms, clean bathrooms, comfortable and new furniture and beds, and some basic amenities, like a pool, exercise room and breakfast.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel chain

reviews.text: We stayed here for a single night on a trip back home for Christmas. The location is convenient to the Ohio Turnpike, and the lobby was nicely decorated. The front desk service was prompt and professional. However, the cleanliness of the room was below par, particularly the bathroom which had soap scum in both the sink (a little) and in the bathtub (an alarming amount). The bathroom fan, which was connected to the only light switch in the bathroom, rattled badly and was terribly loud, so that with my daughter sleeping you had to leave the light out in the bathroom even with the door closed. We travel from the East Coast to Chicago by car a couple of times a year, and there are a lot of hotels along the turnpike, but we won't choose this one again.
reviews.title: It's the attention to details that matter

reviews.text: Room was just OK. The lobby and the hallways looked fairly nice and somewhat new. But when I opened the door to the room, it was just kind of drab and a liitle dated. We checked in at 1AM and were given a room with an adjoining door and could hear everything our neighbors said at 6AM as if there wasn't even a door there. Booked hotel thru Hotwire and was assigned a room with a king bed. Since I was traveling with my adult son, I asked if a room with 2 beds was available. I was told there was, but I would have to pay an upgrade of $25. I realize that when you book thru Hotwire, they can give you any room that they want to. But at 1AM, with rooms available with 2 queens that are priced the same as a king room, why wouldn't you accomodate the customers request and make them happy instead of trying to hit them up for another $25? I don't know. In the end, I would recommend this hotel but book directly with Wingate if you need a specific room. Location is excellent and the pool looked nice.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. I am a platinum member of Holiday Inn and rarely stay elsewhere, however, they were about $25 more a night. I questioned its low price, but decided to chance it. My family and I were so pleasantly surprised. The room was huge, the pool was large, the gym was decent, the breakfast was plentiful and the staff was friendly. On the down side, the towels were a bit dingy and thin and the tub could have used some clorox, but that was really all that could be criticized.
reviews.title: The reviews are right!

reviews.text: This was the second time I have stayed at this Wingate. It is clean and the staff are courteous. It is located near many restaurants and there is a WalMart across the street in case you need something. Wingate provides Neutrogena bathroom products and has an awesome breakfast with fresh waffles. Would definitely stay here again!! Only thing I saw negative this trip was that the pool area didn't look like it had been cleaned before I went in in the morning to use the jacuzzi and the sauna was out of order.
reviews.title: Wingate is a winner!

reviews.text: We belong to Hilton Rewards and when we're traveling we generally stay at Hampton Inn. We arrived at about 10:00 p.m. and the Hampton Inn next door was full. We were tired and went to see if they had a room as we were heading home. It was $89. The room was very clean, had a mini-fridge and microwave. Comfortable beds and nicely decorated. The morning breakfast was fantastic. It was nice to make fresh waffles instead of having those wimpy eggo things Hampton Inn always uses. The people were very pleasant and friendly. We may have to switch rewards to Wyndam now.
reviews.title: Was available and we were pleasantly surprised.

aka: Wingate By Wyndham Streetsboro Hotel Streetsboro
